narrative.title: Explore: The Playhouse
paragraphs: The stuffies wandered through the forest until they spotted a tiny playhouse sitting alone among the trees. Its frame looked broken-down and oddly shaped, as if it had been forgotten for a long time. They stepped closer for a careful inspection, hoping for a way inside. But when they tried the door, it proved to be locked and surprisingly sturdy. With no other choice, they prepared to move on.

vocabulary.definition: The act of looking at something carefully to check it.
examples: The bridge needed a safety inspection.
She made a quick inspection of the room.

vocabulary.definition: Showed to be true or real.
examples: His plan proved to be helpful.
The map proved to be accurate.
The sturdy box held all the books.
They built a sturdy shelter for the night.

events.text: The group comes upon a small building hidden near the path.
Its shape looks uneven, as though time has worn it down.
They test the front entrance to see if it will open.
The entrance cannot be moved and holds firm.

distractors: The building has bright lights glowing from every window.
The door opens the moment they touch it.
A ladder leads easily to an open upper floor.
